parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pray, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to wish; by implication, to pray to God.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From a compound of eu and hodos; to help on the road, i.e. succeed in reaching; figuratively, to succeed in business affairs.
From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of eu and hodos; to help on the road, i.e. succeed in reaching; figuratively, to succeed in business affairs.
